title: Strong correlations and orbital texture in single-layer 1T-TaSe<sub>2</sub>
excerpt: This paper establishes single-layer 1T-TaSe<sub>2</sub> as an intrinsic 2D Mott insulator with exotic orbital texture.
citation: Y. Chen*, W. Ruan*, M. Wu*, S. G. Louie, S.-K. Mo, M. F. Crommie, et al. Nat. Phys. 16, 218 (2020).

title: Physical origin of giant excitonic and magneto-optical responses in two-dimensional ferromagnetic insulators
excerpt: This paper uses first-principles methods to demonstrate the important excitonic effects in optical and magneto-optical properties of 2D magnetic insulators.
citation: M. Wu, Z. Li, T. Cao, and S. G. Louie. Nat. Commun. 10, 2371 (2019).

title: Exchange-driven intravalley mixing of excitons in monolayer transition metal dichalcogenides
excerpt: This paper uses full-spinor GW and GW-BSE methods as well as 2D electronic spectroscopy to manifest the intravalley exchange interaction in monolayer transition metal dichalcogenides.
citation: L. Guo*, M. Wu*, T. Cao*, D. M. Monahan*, Y.-H. Lee, S. G. Louie, and G. R. Fleming. Nat. Phys. 15, 228 (2018)

title: Unifying optical selection rules for excitons in two dimensions: Band topology and winding numbers
excerpt: We show that band topology can dramatically change the photophysics of two-dimensional semiconductors.
citation: T. Cao*, M. Wu*, S. G. Louie. Phys. Rev. Lett. 120, 087402 (2018)

title: Ultrasensitive tunability of the direct bandgap of 2D InSe flakes via strain engineering
excerpt: This paper exploits strain to drastically modify the bandgap of two-dimensional (2D) InSe nanoflakes.
citation: Y. Li*, T. Wang*, M. Wu*, et al. 2D Mater. 5, 021002 (2018)

title: Length-dependent evolution of type II heterojunctions in bottom-up-synthesized graphene nanoribbons
excerpt: This paper reports the local electronic characterization of type II GNR heterojunctions composed of two different nitrogen edge-doping configurations (carbazole and phenanthridine) that separately exhibit electron-donating and electron-withdrawing behavior.
citation: D. J. Rizzo*, M. Wu*, et al. Nano Lett. 19, 3221 (2019)

title: Atomically precise graphene nanoribbon heterojunctions from a single molecular precursor
excerpt: This paper reports the fabrication and electronic characterization of atomically precise GNR heterojunctions prepared through late-stage functionalization of chevron GNRs obtained from a single precursor.
citation: G. D. Nguyen*, H.-Z. Tsai*, A. A. Omrani*, T. Marangoni*, M. Wu*, et al. Nat. Nanotechnol. 12, 1077 (2017)
